featured.text: Laughter (40) is the best medicine, so why not give yourself a treat?
Someone else remarked that “a merry heart does good, like medicine”—and infectious laughter is often catching.
By exhaling air from the lungs in short (36) of laughter, breathing is quickened and heartbeats increased, which achieves (37) good as ten minutes on an exercise bike.

Laughter, too, has a beneficial effect on our immune system, (38) the production of white blood cells and increasing our resistance to infection.(39) makes a difference to our appearance, too, when we relax our facial muscles!
Suddenly, behind me I heard a tapping noise and laughter.

other.text: did you know that according to recent research, people are losing the art of laughter and it could have a (33) effect on our health?
The old sages always used to say that laughter was the best medicine—indeed, better than medicine.
When wholesome laughter fills the air, Some ills will soon depart;
For laughter is good medicine That helps to cheer the heart.

definition.zh_def: 笑聲；因愉快或幽默而發出的聲音。
definition.en_def: The sound of laughing, often expressing amusement or joy.
definition.example: Her laughter filled the room, making everyone feel at ease.
